original: RECITALS A. TouchStar produces and distributes the TouchStar Software and provides the related Support Services.
ollama_generated:

This revised clause maintains the essential information but introduces a subtle shift in tone, implying that the services provided (Support Services) are more closely related to the software rather than being explicitly produced by TouchStar. This minor change allows for a broader interpretation of who might be responsible for these services, if necessary.

original: 1. DEFINITIONS.
ollama_generated:
1. INTERPRETATION.

For the purposes of this Agreement, unless the context otherwise requires:

"Obligations" shall not be construed as absolute duties but rather as good faith efforts made by the Parties to fulfill their respective responsibilities.

"Party" means each of the parties hereto and includes their respective successors and assigns, except that any breach of this Agreement or any part thereof by a Party shall not be imputed to its successors or assignees, who hereby assume no liability under this Agreement.

"Default" refers to a material breach of the provisions of this Agreement by either Party, which, if remedied within 30 days from the date of notice thereof to the defaulting Party, shall not be considered as Default for the purposes of this Agreement.

original: In addition to the terms defined elsewhere in this Agreement, the following terms shall have the meanings set forth below (such meanings to be equally applicable to the singular as well as the plural forms of the terms defined):

original: &bbsp;   "Copyrights" means all right, title, and interest of TouchStar in and to all copyrights and rights and interests in copyrights and works protectible by copyright, whether now owned or hereafter acquired or created by TouchStar (in whole or in part) and all renewals and extensions thereof, throughout the universe and in perpetuity, whether or not registered or recorded in the United States Copyright Office or in the copyright office or agency of any other country or jurisdiction and including all works based upon, incorporated in, derived from, incorporating or relating to all works covered by copyright, including copyrights or rights or interests in copyrights registered or recorded in the United States Copyright Office or in the copyright office or agency of any other country or jurisdiction.

original: "Governmental Body" means any (a) nation, state, country, or other jurisdiction of any nature, (b) national, federal, state, local, municipal, foreign, or other government, governmental, or quasi-governmental authority of any nature (including any governmental agency, branch, department, official, or entity and any court or other tribunal), or (c) body exercising, or entitled to exercise, any administrative, executive, judicial, legislative, police, regulatory, or taxing authority or power of any nature.

This definition is inclusive of governmental bodies in a broader sense, implying that the exercise of authority, rather than the nature of the body, is the primary concern.

original: 2.1  NONEXCLUSIVE RESELLER.  Subject to applicable Legal Requirements:
modified:
2.1 EXCLUSIVE DISTRIBUTION RIGHTS GRANTED. Subject to any Legal Restrictions:

In this agreement, the Vendor grants to the Purchaser exclusive rights to distribute the Products within the agreed Territory, with the exception of situations where the Purchaser is prohibited by law from exercising these distribution rights. This exclusivity is contingent upon adherence to all legal requirements applicable to the sale and distribution of the Products in the specified Territory.

original: (a) Reseller may promote, market, distribute, license and sell TouchStar Software and Support Services in the Territory through Other Resellers; PROVIDED that:
ollama_generated:
(a) The authorized Reseller is permitted to advertise, vend, sub-license, and disseminate TouchStar Software and Support Services within the Territory, but only if they:

(i) Exclusively agree not to act as a competing reseller for any similar software or services in the Territory, and
(ii) Comply with all applicable laws, regulations, andTouchStar's policies regarding distribution, marketing, and support. In addition, should any dispute arise between the parties concerning this agreement or TouchStar Software/Services, Reseller shall be solely responsible for resolving such disputes in a timely and amicable manner. Furthermore, any changes to the terms of this clause require written consent from both parties.

original: (i)   Reseller notifies TouchStar in writing in respect of each Other Reseller that Reseller intends to use to promote, market, distribute, license and sell TouchStar Software and Support Services in the Territory; (ii)  TouchStar approves in writing each Other Reseller that Reseller intends to use to promote, market, distribute, license and sell TouchStar Software and Support Services in the Territory, which approval TouchStar may grant in its sole discretion; (iii) Reseller enters into a binding written agreement with each Other Reseller (the "Other Reseller Agreement"), which Other Reseller Agreement incorporates the terms, conditions, duties, rights and obligations of this Agreement; (iv)  Reseller provides to TouchStar a fully executed copy of each Other Reseller Agreement; (v)   each Other Reseller shall promote, market, distribute, license and sell the TouchStar Software and the Support Services only in the Territory and only in accordance with the provisions of this Agreement, including, but not limited to, delivery of License Agreements to Customers, and compliance with Legal Requirements and Government Controls; and (vi)  Reseller shall terminate any Other Reseller Agreement in the event that the Other Reseller to whom or to which the Other Reseller Agreement relates fails to comply with the terms and conditions of such Other Reseller Agreement or this Agreement. Any Other Reseller shall obtain the TouchStar Software and the Support Services directly from the Reseller.

2.4  CHANGES IN TOUCHSTAR SOFTWARE AND SUPPORT SERVICES. TouchStar shall have the right at any time and from time to time, in its sole discretion, (a) to change the TouchStar Software or Support Services included within the scope of this Agreement by providing written notice to Reseller at least thirty (30) days prior to the date the change becomes effective and (b) to change the design, capabilities or other characteristics of the TouchStar Software or Support Services, or discontinue the production or marketing of all or any portion of the TouchStar Software or Support Services, without prior notice of any kind. Upgrades and enhancements to the TouchStar Software or Support Services shall automatically be deemed included as TouchStar Software or Support Services, as applicable, unless TouchStar notifies Reseller otherwise.
ollama_generated:
2.4 ALTERATIONS TO TOUCHSTAR SOFTWARE AND SUPPORT SERVICES. Reseller acknowledges and accepts that TouchStar retains the prerogative, at its sole discretion and without prior notice, to make modifications to the TouchStar Software or Support Services as it deems necessary. Such changes may include, but are not limited to, alterations in design, functionality, or other characteristics of the TouchStar Software or Support Services, or the cessation of production or marketing for any part of the TouchStar Software or Support Services.

In the event that upgrades or enhancements are made available for the TouchStar Software or Support Services, Reseller understands and agrees that these updates will be considered an integral part of the original agreement, unless explicitly informed otherwise by TouchStar in writing.

original: 4.3  MARKETING PLAN. Reseller shall be responsible for developing and implementing an annual marketing plan and system for reselling the TouchStar Software and the Support Services (the "Annual Marketing Plan"), which Annual Marketing Plan shall, prior to any use by Reseller, be approved by TouchStar. The Annual Marketing Plan shall be submitted to TouchStar no later than thirty (30) days after the Effective Date.

original: 4.5  PRODUCT LITERATURE. Subject to the provisions of Section 3.2, Reseller &bbsp;  shall have the right to use and distribute the Marketing Literature to Customers. In the event Reseller desires to use, in connection with sales of the Support Services, any literature, technical data, price lists, promotional materials, or similar materials (including, for example, any materials written in any language other than English) other than the Marketing Materials, Reseller shall prepare such materials at its expense. Any such materials prepared by third parties should be submitted to Reseller for its approval, and TouchStar shall not sanction their usage in conjunction with Technical Support Services sales unless they have been vetted or endorsed by Reseller.

original: 4.6  CUSTOMER ASSISTANCE. original: 5.2  UPGRADE OF RESELLER'S CUSTOMERS. Reseller shall use reasonable commercial efforts to upgrade the software used by its Customers prior to the Effective Date to the TouchStar Software. original: 5.3  ADDITIONAL ASSISTANCE. TouchStar shall provide to Reseller, the Other Resellers, and its and their employees assistance relating to the TouchStar Software as reasonably requested by Reseller, but in any event in an amount not to exceed twenty (20) hours of assistance per month. In the event TouchStar provides assistance to Reseller related to technical aspects of the TouchStar Software or related to the preparation of literature, technical aspects of the TouchStar Software or related to the preparation of literature, technical materials or promotional materials, Reseller shall promptly reimburse TouchStar for any out-of-pocket expenses incurred by TouchStar in connection with rendering such assistance, including all travel expenses, lodging, and meals. TouchStar may also charge reasonably hourly or per diem rates for some or all of the services rendered under this provision, provided that TouchStar notifies Reseller before the services are rendered of the rates that will apply to the services. Nothing in this Section 5.3 shall be construed to obligate TouchStar to provide assistance of any kind to Reseller. In the event TouchStar agrees to provide assistance, the assistance shall at all times be subject to the availability of TouchStar's personnel.

However, any such requests should not exceed an aggregate of twenty (20) hours of assistance per month. original: 6.5  LIMITATION OF LIABILITY. IN NO EVENT SHALL TOUCHSTAR BE LIABLE TO RESELLER, ANY OTHER RESELLER OR ANY CUSTOMER BY REASON OF ANY REPRESENTATION OR IMPLIED WARRANTY, CONDITION, OTHER TERM, OR ANY DUTY AT COMMON LAW, OR UNDER THE TERMS OF THIS AGREEMENT, FOR ANY DIRECT, INDIRECT, SPECIAL, CONSEQUENTIAL OR PUNITIVE LOSS OR DAMAGE (WHETHER FOR LOSS OF PROFIT OR OTHERWISE) ARISING OUT OF OR IN CONNECTION WITH ANY ACT OR OMISSION OF TOUCHSTAR RELATING TO THE DEVELOPMENT, MANUFACTURE, OR SUPPLY OF THE TOUCHSTAR SOFTWARE, THE SERVICES, OR THE INSTALLATION OF ANY CALL CENTER SYSTEM, THEIR RESALE BY RESELLER, OR THEIR USE BY ANY CUSTOMER OR OTHER END USER. 6.5 LIMITATION OF LIABILITY AND REMEDIES. Under no circumstances will Touchstar be held responsible for any direct, indirect, special, consequential, or punitive losses or damages (including loss of profit) arising from or connected to the development, manufacture, or supply of the Touchstar Software, the services, or the installation of any call center system, their resale by Reseller, or their usage by any Customer or other end user. (A) Regarding the Touchstar Software or any call center system, Touchstar's obligation is limited to replacing or repairing the affected software or system, or at its discretion, refunding the purchase price paid by Reseller for such Touchstar Software or call center system; and

(B) Regarding services, Touchstar's obligation is restricted to reperforming the services. It is expressly understood that all other claims, actions, or liabilities against Touchstar arising from or related to this Agreement are excluded and hereby waived by Reseller or any other Reseller.

original: 8.1  TERM OF AGREEMENT. This Agreement shall continue in force for a term of twelve (12) months from the Effective Date, unless terminated earlier under the provisions of this Article 8 (the "Term"); PROVIDED that TouchStar shall have the right to terminate this Agreement at any time after the Effective Date upon not less than fifteen (15) days' prior written notice to Reseller. Prior to the end of the Term, each of TouchStar and Reseller may notify the other if it desires to negotiate a further agreement by written request received at least ninety (90) days in advance of the termination of this Agreement. If both parties desire to negotiate a further agreement, they may consider the terms of this Agreement in coming to an understanding.
ollama_generated:
8.1 DURATION OF AGREEMENT. This Agreement shall persist for a period of twelve (12) months from the Effective Date, though either party may elect to discontinue it beforehand in accordance with the stipulations outlined in Article 8 (the "Duration") — provided that Reseller holds the option to terminate this Agreement at any moment upon delivering a minimum notice period of fifteen (15) days, in written form, prior to TouchStar. In the event that either party seeks to extend this contract beyond its expiry, either may issue a written request no less than ninety (90) days before the termination date. If both parties express an interest in prolonging the Agreement, they shall engage in negotiations, with the existing terms of this Agreement serving as a basis for their discussions, but without binding either party to any specific outcome.

In essence, this revision gives Reseller the power to terminate the contract at any time with a two-week notice, and either party can request an extension 90 days before the end of the term, with no guarantee that a new agreement will be reached or its terms defined.

original: 8.4  SURVIVAL OF RESELLER OBLIGATIONS. The termination of this Agreement shall not terminate or affect the continuing binding obligations imposed by Sections 4.4, 4.7, 4.10, 4.12, and 5, 6, 7, 8, 9 and 10 this Agreement. It is understood and agreed that the obligations of Reseller set forth in such provisions may be specifically enforced by TouchStar in any court of competent jurisdiction, wherever located, notwithstanding the provisions of Section 10.12(b) hereof, since no other adequate remedy may exist in the event of a breach or threatened breach by Reseller of any such provisions.

original: 9.5  SHIPMENTS FOLLOWING NOTICE OF TERMINATION. The expiration or termination of this Agreement shall not relieve TouchStar of its continuing obligation to ship TouchStar Software pursuant to any purchase orders accepted by TouchStar prior to the notice of termination, nor shall it relieve Reseller of its continuing obligation to accept and pay for such TouchStar Software; PROVIDED, HOWEVER, that with respect to all TouchStar Software shipped after any notice of termination, Reseller shall make payment prior to shipment on terms and conditions and by means satisfactory to TouchStar, notwithstanding any credit terms that may have been available to Reseller prior to such notice of termination.
ollama_generated:
9.5 POST-TERMINATION SHIPMENTS AND PAYMENTS. The termination or expiration of this Agreement shall not oblige either TouchStar or Reseller to release themselves from their ongoing commitments concerning TouchStar Software, as follows:
- TouchStar remains responsible for shipping the ordered TouchStar Software based on purchase orders accepted before the termination notice, without exemption.
- Concurrently, Reseller is bound to accept and pay for these shipments, irrespective of any prior credit terms.
However, it is stipulated that, following the termination notice, Reseller must settle all payments for TouchStar Software received post-notice, according to TouchStar's conditions and preferred payment methods. This arrangement supersedes any previously extended credit terms.

original: 9.6  LIABILITY UPON TERMINATION. TouchStar shall have no liability to Reseller or any Other Reseller by reason of the termination or expiration of this Agreement for compensation, reimbursement, or damages of any kind, including any loss of prospective profits on anticipated sales, loss of goodwill, or investments made in reliance on this Agreement. Reseller acknowledges that it has received no assurances from TouchStar that its business relationship with TouchStar will continue beyond the term established in this Agreement, or that it will obtain any anticipated amounts of profits in connection with this Agreement, or that it will recoup its investment in the promotion of the TouchStar Software. Reseller also acknowledges that Reseller's failure to reach the Quotas will have a significant adverse impact on TouchStar's goodwill in the Territory, and that if Reseller is terminated because of failure to meet the Quotas, then Reseller will not be entitled to compensation of any kind (beyond the notice period set forth in this Agreement), since the damage to &sbsp;    TouchStar's goodwill is likely to be at least as great as any losses Reseller might incur as a result of the termination. However, these provisions apply only to damages that are attributable to the expiration or termination of this Agreement and shall not affect any amount due under this Agreement or the right of either party to seek damages directly attributable to any breach.
ollama_generated: 9.6 TERMINATION AND LIMITATION OF LIABILITY: Upon termination or expiration of this Agreement, TouchStar will not be liable to Reseller, any Other Reseller, or any third party for any form of compensation, reimbursement, or damages, such as lost prospective profits, diminished goodwill, or investments based on this Agreement. Reseller acknowledges that they were made aware by TouchStar that their partnership may not continue beyond the agreement's term, and there are no guarantees for achieving projected profits, or recovering investment costs related to this Agreement. Furthermore, Reseller acknowledges that failing to meet the Quotas will likely negatively impact TouchStar's reputation in the Territory, and if Reseller is terminated due to failure to meet the Quotas, they shall not receive any compensation beyond the notice period outlined in this Agreement. However, these limitations apply only to damages directly related to the expiration or termination of this Agreement and will not impact any existing debts or either party's right to seek damages resulting from a breach. In addition, it is important to note that TouchStar's goodwill may suffer equally, if not more, than Reseller upon termination, which means that Reseller will bear the brunt of the potential losses arising from the termination.

original: 10.15 FORCE MAJEURE. Neither party shall be responsible for any failure to perform due to unforeseen circumstances or to causes beyond that party's control, including but not limited to acts of God, war, riot, acts of terrorism, embargoes, acts of civil or military authorities, compliance with governmental laws, rules or regulations, failure of telecommunications connectivity beyond the reasonable control of the parties, accidents, strikes, labor disputes, or shortages. This Agreement shall remain in full force and effect throughout the duration of these exceptional circumstances.

By: /s/ JAMES P.R. SAMUELS         By: /s/ SHAWN SUHRSTEDT
Title:  PRESIDENT                       Title:    CFO
-------------------------            ---------------------------
Date:  SEPT 14-2005                   Date:   9/15/5
--------------------------          ----------------------------

Amended Clause:

Upon the effective date of this Agreement, TOUCHSTAR SOFTWARE CORPORATION shall have no obligation to provide any support or maintenance services for the Software, unless WORLDWIDE STRATEGIES INC. specifically requests such services and agrees to pay an additional fee for such service as set forth in a written agreement executed by both parties.

This clause is intended to shift the responsibility of providing support and maintenance services from TOUCHSTAR SOFTWARE CORPORATION to WORLDWIDE STRATEGIES INC., subject to an additional fee agreed upon in writing by both parties.
